t: Proverbs 22
A*pn good*i name is to be chosen rather than great riches, Loving*ld favor rather than silver and gold.
The*ln rich and the poor have this in common, The*ld Lord*s is*i the maker of them all.
A*ln prudent man*i foresees evil and hides himself, But*ld the simple pass on and are punished.
By*ln humility and*i the fear of the Lord*s Are*ild riches and honor and life.
Thorns*ln and*i snares are*i in the way of the perverse; He*ld who guards his soul will be far from them.
Train*ln up a child in the way he should go, And*ld when he is old he will not depart from it.
The*ln rich rules over the poor, And*ld the borrower is*i servant to the lender.
He*ln who sows iniquity will reap sorrow, And*ld the rod of his anger will fail.
He*ln who has a generous eye will be blessed, For*ld he gives of his bread to the poor.
Cast*ln out the scoffer, and contention will leave; Yes,*ld strife and reproach will cease.
He*ln who loves purity of heart And*ild has*i grace on his lips, The*ld king will*i be*i his friend.
The*ln eyes of the Lord*s preserve knowledge, But*ld He overthrows the words of the faithless.
The*ln lazy man*i says, “There*i is*i a lion outside! I*ld shall be slain in the streets!”
The*ln mouth of an immoral woman is*i a deep pit; He*ld who is abhorred by the Lord*s will fall there.
Foolishness*ln is*i bound up in the heart of a child; The*ld rod of correction will drive it far from him.
He*ln who oppresses the poor to increase his riches,*i And*ild he who gives to the rich, will*i surely come*i to poverty.
Sayings of the Wise
Incline*pn your ear and hear the words of the wise, And*ld apply your heart to my knowledge;
For*ld it*i is*i a pleasant thing if you keep them within you; Let*ld them all be fixed upon your lips,
So*ld that your trust may be in the Lord;*s I*ld have instructed you today, even you.
Have*ld I not written to you excellent things Of*ld counsels and knowledge,
That*ld I may make you know the certainty of the words of truth, That*ld you may answer words of truth To*ld those who send to you?
Do*ln not rob the poor because he is*i poor, Nor*ld oppress the afflicted at the gate;
For*ld the Lord*s will plead their cause, And*ld plunder the soul of those who plunder them.
Make*ln no friendship with an angry man, And*ld with a furious man do not go,
Lest*ld you learn his ways And*ld set a snare for your soul.
Do*ln not be one of those who shakes hands in a pledge, One*ld of those who is surety for debts;
If*ld you have nothing with*i which*i to pay, Why*ld should he take away your bed from under you?
Do*ln not remove the ancient landmark Which*ld your fathers have set.
Do*ln you see a man who*i excels in his work? He*ld will stand before kings; He*ld will not stand before unknown men.*i
